article.headline: Louisville 74, Ohio 71
article.story: LOUISVILLE, Ky. (AP) -- Freshman guard Edgar Sosa scored a career-high 22 points, including 10 straight late in the second half, to lead Louisville to a 74-71 win over Ohio in the opening game of the NABC Classic on Friday. Terrence Williams added 12 points, eight assists and six rebounds as the Cardinals (3-2) withstood a late push by the Bobcats (4-2) to remain undefeated at Freedom Hall this season. Sonny Troutman led the Bobcats with 22 points and Jerome Tillman had 18 points and 13 rebounds, but the Bobcats couldn't pull off the upset after erasing a 16-point deficit. Louisville appeared ready to pull away after it went on a 16-3 run early in the second half to put the Cardinals up 51-35. But the Bobcats rallied to get within 56-55 with 5:42 to play. Sosa took over from there, hitting a pair of 3-pointers, a couple of free throws and a pretty runner in the lane to help the Cardinals ease to the finish. Louisville built an early 10-point lead, but allowed Ohio back into the game with sloppy ballhandling. The Cardinals had more turnovers (13) than field goals (10) at the half, but the Bobcats couldn't take advantage, shooting just 28 percent from the field as the teams went to the break tied at 27.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
